sourcesContent:
import React, {useState} from 'react' import { Button, Card, Image, Icon } from 'semantic-ui-react' function ProjectCard() { const [projectDetails, setProjectDetails] = useState({ projectName: [ "I'm Bored!", "Password Generator", "Burger Love", "Workday Scheduler", "Episode Two", "Note Taker", ], description: [ "Random movie, book, and video game generator.", "Create simple passwords.", "Keep track of burgers you want to eat.", "Plan your day.", "Stay in a galaxy far far away.", "A place to take quick simple notes." ], repoLink: [ "https://github.com/Mirandor/team-sith", "https://github.com/Mirandor/pwdgen", "https://github.com/Mirandor/burgerlove", "https://github.com/Mirandor/workdayscheduler", "https://github.com/Mirandor/Episode-two", "https://github.com/Mirandor/notetaker" ], liveLink: [ "https://mirandor.github.io/team-sith/", "https://mirandor.github.io/pwdgen/", "https://rocky-sierra-19969.herokuapp.com/", "https://mirandor.github.io/workdayscheduler/", "https://damp-badlands-10024.herokuapp.com/", "https://notetaker-darthmirandor.herokuapp.com/" ], imageLink: [ "/Images/PasswordGenerator.png", "/Images/ForTheLoveOfBurgers.png", "/Images/WorkDayScheduler.png", "/Images/EpisodeTwo.png", "/Images/NoteTaker.png" ] }) console.log(projectDetails) return (
{projectDetails.projectName.map ( projectName =>{ return( {projectName} {projectDetails.description}
) } )}
) } export default ProjectCard;
